listitem.para: There are two ways to browse the data in FlyMine: 1. directly from the main query page or 2. through a query you construct yourself.

The FlyMine Browse search, accessible from the main query page (see screenshot below), allows you to quickly and directly access the data in FlyMine. Entering any object identifier (such as a gene name or identifier) will take you straight to the details page for that object (see Object details pages.) Wildcards are automatically attached to any text entered and so your search may match more than one object in the database. In such a case a list of all matching objects is shown, from where you can access the object details page.

Queries can be constructed using the FlyMine query builder in such a way that the results are browsable. If you select an entire class to 'show' in the output (as opposed to selecting attributes of a class, see screenshot below), your result will provide a link to a details page for the objects returned from that class. See Object details pages for more details.
